title: Micah Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Micah with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 7 chapters.

questions.question: In whose days did the word of the LORD come to Micah the Morasthite?
questions.explanation: Micah received the word of the LORD during the reigns of Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah.

questions.question: What does Micah say will happen to the mountains under the LORD's coming?
options: They shall be melted like wax
They shall be covered with snow
They shall be shaken but remain standing
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be melted like wax
questions.explanation: Micah describes mountains melting under the LORD’s presence, like wax before fire.

questions.question: According to Micah, what is the transgression of Jacob?
questions.explanation: Micah identifies Samaria as the transgression of Jacob.

questions.question: What will happen to the graven images of Samaria according to Micah?
options: They shall be beaten to pieces
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be beaten to pieces
questions.explanation: Micah prophesies that the graven images of Samaria will be destroyed completely.

questions.question: Where does Micah instruct not to declare the coming judgment?
questions.explanation: Micah commands not to declare the judgment at Gath and not to weep there.

questions.question: What does Micah command to do as a sign of mourning for his children?
options: Make thee bald and poll thee
questions.correctAnswer: Make thee bald and poll thee
questions.explanation: Micah instructs to shave the head as an expression of mourning for the captivity of his children.

questions.question: In Micah 2, what do the wicked covet and take by violence?
questions.explanation: The wicked covet fields and houses and take them by violence, oppressing others.

questions.question: According to Micah 2, what will the LORD do to those who oppress His people?
questions.explanation: God declares He will devise an evil against oppressors from which they shall not remove their necks.

questions.question: Who does Micah say will be gathered as sheep of Bozrah?
questions.explanation: The LORD promises to gather the remnant of Israel as sheep in Bozrah.

questions.question: What title does Micah give to the LORD in chapter 3, verse 8?
options: The Judge of all the earth
Full of power by the spirit of the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: Full of power by the spirit of the LORD
questions.explanation: Micah declares he is filled with power by the spirit of the LORD to declare Israel’s sin.

questions.question: Micah 3 condemns the leaders of Israel for doing which of the following?
options: Building Zion with blood and Jerusalem with iniquity
Feeding the poor and healing the sick
questions.correctAnswer: Building Zion with blood and Jerusalem with iniquity
questions.explanation: The leaders are condemned for injustice, building Zion with bloodshed and sin.

questions.question: What will happen to the vision and prophecy of the false prophets according to Micah 3?
options: They will be dark and have no answer from God
questions.correctAnswer: They will be dark and have no answer from God
questions.explanation: Micah says the day shall be dark over the prophets with no divine answer.

questions.question: In Micah 4, what shall many nations do?
options: Come to the mountain of the LORD to learn His ways
questions.correctAnswer: Come to the mountain of the LORD to learn His ways
questions.explanation: Many nations will come to the LORD’s mountain to learn His paths.

questions.question: According to Micah 4, what will nations do with their swords and spears?
options: Turn them into plowshares and pruninghooks
Use them to defend their cities
questions.correctAnswer: Turn them into plowshares and pruninghooks
questions.explanation: Nations will transform weapons of war into tools for peaceful labor.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'But they shall sit every man under his __ and under his fig tree; and none shall make them afraid.'
questions.explanation: Micah 4:4 promises peace and security under one’s vine and fig tree.

questions.question: What is the 'tower of the flock' referred to in Micah 4:8?
options: A stronghold of the daughter of Zion
questions.correctAnswer: A stronghold of the daughter of Zion
questions.explanation: The tower of the flock is described as a stronghold and symbol of dominion for Zion.

questions.question: True or False: Micah 1:9 warns not to weep in the house of Aphrah.
questions.explanation: Micah 1:10 says, 'weep ye not at all: in the house of Aphrah roll thyself in the dust,' instructing mourning there.

questions.question: True or False: Micah 3 states that the priests and prophets teach and divine for money.
questions.explanation: Micah condemns leaders who judge and teach for reward and divine for money.

questions.question: True or False: According to Micah 7, the good man is plentiful upon the earth.
questions.explanation: Micah 7:2 laments the good man is perished and none upright remain.

questions.question: True or False: Micah 7:18 praises God as one who delights in mercy and pardons iniquity.
questions.explanation: Micah highlights God's mercy and forgiveness toward His people.

questions.question: What does Micah say will happen to Jerusalem for their sins in chapter 3?
options: It will become heaps and be plowed as a field
It will be exalted above all cities
questions.correctAnswer: It will become heaps and be plowed as a field
questions.explanation: Micah prophesies Jerusalem will be destroyed and reduced to heaps.

questions.question: According to Micah 7:7, what will the prophet do in response to the evil around him?
options: Look unto the LORD and wait for salvation
questions.correctAnswer: Look unto the LORD and wait for salvation
questions.explanation: Micah resolves to trust and wait for God’s salvation despite corruption.

questions.question: In Micah 2:11, who is described as a prophet of this people if he lies about wine and strong drink?
questions.explanation: Micah sarcastically calls one who lies of wine a prophet, implying false prophecy.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'The breaker is come up before them: they have broken up, and have passed through the gate, and are gone out by it: and their king shall pass before them, and the LORD on the head of them.'
questions.explanation: The 'breaker' is the one who leads the way for the people’s deliverance.

questions.question: What is the punishment described in Micah 1 for Samaria?
options: To be made a vineyard heap and stones poured into the valley
To be exalted above all cities
questions.correctAnswer: To be made a vineyard heap and stones poured into the valley
questions.explanation: Samaria will be destroyed and become like a heap of a vineyard.

questions.question: True or False: Micah 4:5 says that all people will walk every one in the name of the LORD our God forever and ever.
questions.explanation: Micah 4:5 says, 'For all people will walk every one in the name of his god, and we will walk in the name of the LORD our God for ever and ever.'

questions.question: What does Micah 7:19 say God will do with the sins of His people?
options: Cast them into the depths of the sea
questions.correctAnswer: Cast them into the depths of the sea
questions.explanation: God will forgive and cast all their sins into the depths of the sea.

questions.question: Who does Micah say will be afraid of the LORD and fear because of Israel in chapter 7?
questions.explanation: Nations will be afraid of the LORD and fear because of Israel's God.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Feed thy people with thy rod, the flock of thine ____, which dwell solitarily in the wood.'
questions.explanation: Micah 7:14 calls God's people His heritage to be fed with His rod.

questions.question: What is a major theme in the book of Micah, especially emphasized in chapters 6 and 7?
questions.explanation: Micah highlights God’s justice against sin and His mercy towards repentant people.

questions.question: True or False: Micah 4:3 teaches that nation shall no longer lift up a sword against nation nor learn war anymore.
questions.explanation: Micah prophesies a future time of peace where war will cease.

questions.question: What does Micah say the prince and judge ask for in Micah 7:3?
questions.explanation: Micah condemns leaders who ask for bribes to pervert justice.

questions.question: True or False: Micah 2:6 says the people say to the prophets, 'Prophesy ye not,' so they shall not prophesy to them.
questions.explanation: People reject the true prophets, forbidding them to prophesy.

questions.question: In Micah 1, which city is called the 'beginning of sin to the daughter of Zion'?
questions.explanation: Lachish is identified as the beginning of sin to Zion.

questions.question: What is the response of those who put not into the mouths of the false prophets, according to Micah 3?
questions.explanation: False prophets attack those who do not feed them lies.

questions.question: True or False: Micah 7:8 encourages rejoicing when one falls, because the LORD is a light in darkness.
questions.explanation: Micah encourages hope, stating the LORD will be a light in times of darkness.

questions.question: Who does Micah say will come even to the daughter of Zion from Assyria and from fortified cities in chapter 7?
questions.explanation: Micah promises God will bring deliverance from Assyria and other places.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'According to the days of thy coming out of the land of ____, will I shew unto him marvellous things.'
questions.explanation: God promises to show marvelous things according to Israel’s exodus from Egypt.

questions.question: What is the attitude of the people towards each other in Micah 7:6?
questions.explanation: Micah describes sons dishonoring fathers and family members becoming enemies.

questions.question: According to Micah 7:16, what will the nations do upon seeing the might of Israel's God?
options: Be confounded and lay hands upon their mouths
questions.correctAnswer: Be confounded and lay hands upon their mouths
questions.explanation: The nations will be astonished and silenced by God’s power.

questions.question: True or False: Micah 1:12 mentions the inhabitants of Maroth waiting carefully for evil.
questions.explanation: The inhabitants of Maroth awaited good, but evil came from the LORD.

questions.question: Who is described as 'the glory of Israel' that will come unto Adullam according to Micah 1?
questions.explanation: Micah promises to bring an heir, the glory of Israel, unto Adullam.

questions.question: True or False: Micah 2:8 accuses the people of pulling off the robe and garment from those passing securely.
questions.explanation: The people are accused of violently stripping others of their clothing.

questions.question: What is Micah's overall message concerning the leaders of Israel in chapter 3?
options: They pervert justice and lead the people astray
questions.correctAnswer: They pervert justice and lead the people astray
questions.explanation: Micah condemns leaders who hate good, love evil, and pervert equity.

questions.question: What will happen 'in that day' to the daughter of Zion according to Micah 4:10?
options: She shall go forth of the city and be delivered
She shall hide in the mountains
questions.correctAnswer: She shall go forth of the city and be delivered
questions.explanation: Micah predicts Zion will go out of the city to Babylon and be redeemed.
